title: Two mixtures of milk and water contain 10% and 20% water. In what ratio should the two mixtures be mixed so that the resulting mixture contains 16% water? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let us say you want to produce 100 L of the 16% mixture Let the volume of 10% milk = X litre Then the volume of 20 % milk = (100 - x) litres C1V1 + C2V2 = C3V3 10*x + 20*100-x) = 16*100 10x + 2000 - 20 x = 1600 10x = 400 x = 40 L crude ratio = 40:60 You must mix the two in ratio : 2parts 10% and 3 parts 20%
